thread.title: Search for missing Taupo woman | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Search for missing Taupo woman | Stuff.co.nz

title: Search for missing Taupo woman | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Search for missing Taupo woman Last updated 15:39, February 21 2017 POLICE 
Police are searching for missing 75-year-old Taupo woman Barbara Thompson. 
Police are searching for a missing 75-year-old Taupo woman who has not been seen since the early hours of Tuesday morning. 
Barbara Thompson regularly fishes at the mouth of Waitahanui River, 5km from her home, first thing in the morning and usually returns home by 9am. 
She did not return home on Tuesday. MATT SHAND/FAIRFAX NZ 
A rahui, ban from fishing, has been placed at the mouth of the Waitahanui River after Barbara Thompson went missing after fishing there on Tuesday morning. 
Police were called at 11am, after Thompson's husband searched the area himself. 
A rahui- ban- has now been placed at the river mouth telling people not to fish in the area. 
She is described as approximately 1.6 metres tall, of slim build and has short grey hair. 
She left her home in her car at approximately 5.30am on Tuesday morning and the car is still parked at the car park, near the Waitahanui River. 
There have been no further signs of her. 
The Harbourmaster and the Coastguard have been searching the water, while Police and a number of locals have been searching nearby tracks. 
If anyone has seen Thompson, they are urged to call Police immediately.
